author: Eugenia Cheng
title: The Best Way to Think About Probabilities
text:
This past April saw many Chicagoans complaining about how cold it was. But I wasn’t surprised—the weather seemed entirely within the expected range. Was I justified in shrugging off the chill?
The daily low temperatures were very low—in fact, on all but three days in April they were below average for that day, according to AccuWeather. Assuming the numbers are equally likely to be above or below average, it might seem that this is equivalent to tossing a coin 30 times and getting heads only three times, or odds of 1 in 125,000....
